LanguageData.JDP_DepletionLabel: {0} mining operations before digpit is unusable
LanguageData.JDP_TooltipLetter: Select whether or not the soil reclamation letter has already been sent. If false, the letter will be sent the first time a digpit is deconstructed.
LanguageData.JDP_TooltipChunkChance: Chance to get a chunk. If junk is mined, this is the chance to get chunks instead of rubble.\n\nMining blocks uses chunk chance to determine whether a sufficient amount of stone was mined to make blocks
LanguageData.JDP_RaptorsInfo: Your scientists were so preoccupied with whether or not they could, they didnâ€™t stop to think if they should. \n\n Note: if disabled, no dino reconstruction.
LanguageData.JDP_Life: Life cannot be contained. Life breaks free. Life finds a way
LanguageData.JDP_LifeInfo: If disabled, no dinosaurs will come wandering on the map. You'll only be able to get dinos through reconstruction.
LanguageData.JDP_ChangedSettings: CHANGED SETTINGS NEED A GAME RESTART TO TAKE EFFECT. BLAME MEHNI.
LanguageData.JDP_ReportNotEnoughStone: The digpit needs to be built in an area with more unquarried stone
LanguageData.JDP_CommandSetOwnerDesc: Assign this digpit to only be mined by certain colonists.
LanguageData.JDP_LetterText: Once the digpit has been deconstructed, you can designate colonists to cover the old ground with soil in order to get a usable terrain where the digpit once was. Use the Reclaim Soil command to designate an area for reclaiming.
LanguageData.JDP_DescriptionReclaimSoil: Turn loose stone terrain from a digpit into usable soil terrain.
LanguageData.JDP_MessageSinkhole: Shifting rocks in the digpit has injured [PAWN_nameDef].
